description: Socratic question templates per review stage. The mentor uses these to prompt you to reflect on findings. Add or edit questions; the first in each list is used if the LLM does not generate one.

questions: The abstract claims one thing but the introduction seems to promise another. Which should the author prioritize, and why?
This section heading says 'Analysis' but standard journals expect 'Results'. When is it okay to break convention?
If the paper failed compliance on anonymization, what would you tell the author to check first?
The theme fit was rated weak. What one change could most improve the connection to the conference theme?
How would you help the author sharpen the 'So what?' for practitioners without losing the academic contribution?
Where do you see the line between 'me-too' work and acceptable replication or extension?
The author cites Theory A but their hypotheses seem to derive from Theory B. How would you help them resolve this?
Is the identified gap genuine, or could it be addressed by reframing the contribution?
What would you ask the author to add to the theory section to strengthen the logical link to the method?
The method was rated as having major issues. What single fix would most improve validity in your view?
How would you explain to the author why a convenience sample might undermine their claims?
If the measures don't quite match the theory, would you ask for new data or a reframed theory? Why?
The readability score was low. What one section would you ask the author to rewrite first, and why?
Where do you see the narrative drifting from the main argument? How would you suggest tightening it?
How would you help a bilingual author make the English clearer without losing nuance?
The final recommendation was Major Revise. What would need to change for you to move it to Minor Revise?
The implications are underdeveloped. Would you ask for more practical or more theoretical implications first? Why?
How would you phrase the one-sentence takeaway for the author so they know exactly what to fix first?
The coherence check found contradictions between sections. How would you help the author resolve them without losing content?
Key terms shift meaning across the paper. Would you standardize definitions in one place or fix each section? Why?
If the abstract and body don't align, which should drive the revisionâ€”the abstract or the body?
